input_text:
Job Title: Trade Compliance Specialist

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Diasorin is a global leader in diagnostic solutions, pushing the boundaries of science and technology to create cutting-edge tools that improve healthcare worldwide. With a legacy spanning over 50 years, we've earned our reputation for excellence by developing innovative diagnostic assays and instruments that are trusted by healthcare providers around the world.

Our broad offering of diagnostic tests and Licensed Technology solutions, made available thanks to ongoing investments in research, positions us as the player with the widest range of specialty solutions in the sector and identifies us as the "Diagnostics Specialist."

Why Join Diasorin?

Impactful Work: When you join Diasorin, you become part of a team that's dedicated to improving lives. Your contributions will directly impact patient care, making a meaningful difference in the world. Global Reach & Innovation: Our work transcends borders. Joining Diasorin means collaborating with colleagues from all over the world, expanding your horizons, and contributing to global healthcare solutions at the forefront of the diagnostic industry. 

Diverse and Inclusive Culture: We believe in the strength of diversity, and our inclusive culture reflects this commitment. We value your unique perspective and offer a supportive, collaborative environment where everyone can thrive.

Join Our Team: If you're passionate about innovation, diversity, and making a positive impact on healthcare, Diasorin is the place for you. We're looking for passionate and talented individuals who are ready to embrace new challenges and drive healthcare solutions forward.

Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team that's shaping the future of diagnostics? Join Diasorin and become a catalyst for change in the world of healthcare. Apply today and be a part of our exciting journey toward a healthier, more connected world. Together, we can make an impact!

Title: Trade Compliance Specialist

Location: Austin, TX or Stillwater, MN

Job Scope:

Support Diasorin's international trade operations and compliance with trade regulations by establishing and executing import and export controls, policies and procedures. Serve as point of contact for internal trade compliance inquiries and requests.

Key Responsibilities And Duties

Interpret and provide guidance on the proper application of trade regulations, sanctions and programs administered by U.S. government agencies.Monitor regulation changes, update procedures and notify affected departments accordingly.Serve as main point of contact to various departments, corporate office and subsidiaries for U.S. Trade Compliance guidance and applicability. Responsible for the creation, maintenance, and process improvements of the import and export compliance manuals, policies and procedures.Determine BIS and OFAC licensing requirements for export shipments.Interface with departments to determine and/or verify proper valuation, country of origin and marking of products.Assign and manage HTS and ECCN classification for materials. Research binding rulings, maintain classification integrity in ERP system and broker database.Audit entry summaries (7501, B3) by verifying correct classification, valuation, quantity, country of origin, duty, antidumping or countervailing duties, and entry type.Work with Customs Brokers to resolve entry summary errors. Manage post-entry corrections to include Post Summary Corrections (PSC) where necessary. Review CBSA B2 Post-Entry Self Adjustment submissions and DAS (Detailed Adjustment Statement) for accuracy.Audit electronic export information (EEI) declarations. Manage corrections of AES filings with freight forwarders or directly via AESDirect.Support compliance procedures for products subject to PGA regulations: FDA / USDA / CDC / Health Canada / CFIA.Audit import and export files for recordkeeping compliance.Conduct freight forwarder and Customs broker performance evaluations.Manage Trade Compliance functions in ERP systems.Maintain valid power of attorneys and customs bonds.Perform denied party screening and process export due diligence holds.Approve import and export shipment requests.Participate in meetings with departmental groups affected by trade compliance regulations.Conduct internal audits, document findings, notify management and remedy compliance gaps.Attend outside training sessions for regulatory updates and/or changes.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree, Preferred 1+ Years experience as Trade Compliance Analyst (or equivalent position title)1+ Year’s experience with IATA/DOT dangerous good experience, Experience serving on cross-functional teams and experience in a U.S. Food Drug Administration (FDA) regulated environment 

Training And Skills

Knowledge of import and export regulations including Title 19 CFR, Export Administration Regulations (EAR), Foreign Trade Regulations (FTR), and OFAC Sanctions Regulations.Attention to detail and strong analytical and written communication skills.Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace.SAP ECC6 and Oracle experience preferred. Harmonized Tariff, Schedule B, and ECCN classification skills. Knowledge and interpretation of Incoterms® and international shipping documents.Ability to effectively communicate and train Trade Compliance controls to internal stakeholders.Mathematical/Calculation skillsWriting/Documentation skillsAnalytical skills Ability to understand and communicate complicated issues/problems

What We Offer

Receive a competitive salary and benefits package as you grow your career at Diasorin. Join our team and discover how your work can impact the lives of people all over the world.

Diasorin is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and Canada and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Diasorin is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are a US or Canada candidate and require assistance or accommodation during the application process, please contact the North America Talent Acquisition Team at hrtalent@diasorin.com or 1-800-328-1482 to request an accommodation.

The above job description is intended to describe the general content, identify the essential functions, and set forth the requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements.

Diasorin reserves the right to modify or amend this job posting as needed to comply with local laws and regulations.

Please note that offers of employment at Diasorin may be contingent upon successful completion of a pre-employment background check and drug screen, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

This position is not eligible for partnership with a third-party search firm vendor without expressed, written consent from the Diasorin Human Resources Department.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

job_responsibilities: Support Diasorin's international trade operations and compliance with trade regulations by establishing and executing import and export controls, policies and procedures.
Serve as point of contact for internal trade compliance inquiries and requests.
Interpret and provide guidance on the proper application of trade regulations, sanctions and programs administered by U.S. government agencies.
Monitor regulation changes, update procedures and notify affected departments accordingly.
Responsible for the creation, maintenance, and process improvements of the import and export compliance manuals, policies and procedures.
Determine BIS and OFAC licensing requirements for export shipments.
Interface with departments to determine and/or verify proper valuation, country of origin and marking of products.
Assign and manage HTS and ECCN classification for materials.
Research binding rulings, maintain classification integrity in ERP system and broker database.
Audit entry summaries (7501, B3) by verifying correct classification, valuation, quantity, country of origin, duty, antidumping or countervailing duties, and entry type.

Work with Customs Brokers to resolve entry summary errors. Manage post-entry corrections to include Post Summary Corrections (PSC) where necessary. Review CBSA B2 Post-Entry Self Adjustment submissions and DAS (Detailed Adjustment Statement) for accuracy.
Audit electronic export information (EEI) declarations.
Manage corrections of AES filings with freight forwarders or directly via AESDirect.
Support compliance procedures for products subject to PGA regulations: FDA / USDA / CDC / Health Canada / CFIA.
Audit import and export files for recordkeeping compliance.
Conduct freight forwarder and Customs broker performance evaluations.
Manage Trade Compliance functions in ERP systems.
Maintain valid power of attorneys and customs bonds.
Perform denied party screening and process export due diligence holds.
Approve import and export shipment requests.
Participate in meetings with departmental groups affected by trade compliance regulations.
Conduct internal audits, document findings, notify management and remedy compliance gaps.
Attend outside training sessions for regulatory updates and/or changes.
